treatment.description: Superficially suggesting no. 16 but leaves downy beneath and shorter pedicels spreading ascending; canes stout, intricately branched, the main axis up to 5 or 6 mm. thick, strongly armed with horizontally divergent subulate hard prickles up to 6 mm,, long; primocane-leaflets 3 or 5, scabridulous with sparse hairs above, velvety beneath; the terminal leaflet of the main axis ovate to ovate-elliptic, abruptly acuminate, 4.5-7.5 cm. long and 2.5-5 cm. broad, sharply double-serrate; floricane-leaves subcoriaceous, blue-green; corymb with several flowers on mostly arching glandless villous pedicels up to 2 or 3 cm. long, these rarely overtopping the brads.
